required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Early Prediction and Randomised Prevention of Preeclampsia With Low Dose Aspirin in Chinese Cohort
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Muti-center Study of Early Prediction and Randomised Prevention of Preeclampsia With Low Dose Aspirin in Chinese Cohort

brief_summary.textblock: This study intends to adopt the method of multi-center prospective randomized controlled study. The aim of this study is to obtain localized excision values through a preeclampsia screening model established in early pregnancy, and to evaluate the efficacy of low-dose aspirin intervention for preeclampsia prevention in pregnant women at high risk of screening.

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: Hypertensive onset after 20 weeks of gestation is accompanied by proteinuria,or with thrombocytopenia, impaired liver function, renal insufficiency,pulmonary edema,headache without other explanation and so on.

primary_outcome.measure: the rate of hypertensive disorder during pregnancy
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: gestational hypertension, preeclampsia, chronic hypertension with preeclampsia, eclampsia, HELLP syndrome

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: After 20 weeks of pregnancy, the placenta in its normal position is completely or partially removed from the uterine wall before delivery of the fetus

primary_outcome.measure: the rate of fetal growth restriction
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: The birth weight of the fetus is below two standard deviations of the average weight for the same gestational age or below the 10th percentile of normal weight for the same age
Within 24 hours after the delivery of the fetus, the bleeding volume of vaginal delivery ≥500ml, cesarean delivery ≥1000ml

primary_outcome.measure: the time and type of delivery
primary_outcome.description: gestational week, vaginal delivery and cesarean section

secondary_outcome.description: macrosomia, normal weight, low birth weight

secondary_outcome.measure: the rate of Neonatal NICU occupancy rate
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year

arm_group.description: aspirin,tablet,100/150mg per day,(BMI<30 100mg/d，BMI≥30 150mg/d)，from pregnancy weeks<16 to 35 weeks or the day of delivery.

intervention.description: With the result of risk assessment for high risk and the risk of pregnant women, with each research center stratified random aspirin drug intervention, for each center screening high-risk and accord with the standard drug intervention study phase into eliminate pregnant women by using stochastic indicator 1:1 randomly into low-dose aspirin to prevent group and observation group, for each center in screening for risk and comply with the drug intervention study phase into the exclusion standard 1:1 by random indicator method pregnant women randomly into low-dose aspirin to prevent group and observation group.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 1)Pregnant women assessed as at high risk of preeclampsia 2) live pregnancy 3) gestational weeks < 16 weeks 4) agree to randomized drug intervention studies 5) follow up regularly and obtain reliable pregnancy outcomes
Exclusion Criteria:
- 1)with severe fetal or chromosomal abnormalities 2) induced labor or spontaneous abortion due to social factors 3) absolute or relative contraindications to aspirin use (allergy to aspirin or other salicylate, or other ingredients of the drug;Acute gastrointestinal ulcer;Active bleeding;In patients with severe G6PD deficiency, acetylsalicylic acid may induce hemolysis or hemolytic anemia.Aspirin asthma)

reference.citation: Duley L. The global impact of pre-eclampsia and eclampsia. Semin Perinatol. 2009 Jun;33(3):130-7. doi: 10.1053/j.semperi.2009.02.010. Review.

Say L, Chou D, Gemmill A, Tunçalp Ö, Moller AB, Daniels J, Gülmezoglu AM, Temmerman M, Alkema L. Global causes of maternal death: a WHO systematic analysis. Lancet Glob Health. 2014 Jun;2(6):e323-33. doi: 10.1016/S2214-109X(14)70227-X. Epub 2014 May 5. Review.

Hypertension in pregnancy. Report of the American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists' Task Force on Hypertension in Pregnancy. Obstet Gynecol. 2013 Nov;122(5):1122-1131. doi: 10.1097/01.AOG.0000437382.03963.88.

Akolekar R, Syngelaki A, Poon L, Wright D, Nicolaides KH. Competing risks model in early screening for preeclampsia by biophysical and biochemical markers. Fetal Diagn Ther. 2013;33(1):8-15. doi: 10.1159/000341264. Epub 2012 Aug 16. Erratum in: Fetal Diagn Ther. 2013;34(1):43.

Prediction and prevention of early-onset pre-eclampsia: impact of aspirin after first-trimester screening. Ultrasound Obstet Gynecol. 2015 Oct;46(4):419-23. doi: 10.1002/uog.14819. Epub 2015 Aug 31.

Wright D, Nicolaides KH. Aspirin delays the development of preeclampsia. Am J Obstet Gynecol. 2019 Jun;220(6):580.e1-580.e6. doi: 10.1016/j.ajog.2019.02.034. Epub 2019 Feb 21.

patient_data.ipd_description: The aim of this study was to obtain localized excision values through a preeclampsia screening model established in early pregnancy, and to evaluate the efficacy of low-dose aspirin intervention for preeclampsia prevention in pregnant women at high risk of screening.
